intro: Spermacoce verticillata, commonly known as the whorled false shamrock, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive whorled arrangement of leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fruits are dry, dehiscent capsules that release small, smooth seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
